channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: This is the pathway down the side of badhams in sixways. Leading from the carpark to the London road. Liquid which looks like sewage is coming out of manhole. It's getting worse., 21st July
item.description:
Sewage maybe. On pavement.

item.title: Painted 'Walking' logo needed at crossing in Cheltenham, 21st July
item.description:
While the cycling path is well marked with cycling logos pedestrians are crossing in, and in the opposite direction to cyclist. Could you plan to mark, with a walking logo, in the adjacent lane at the same crossing. Location: is corner of Cote Cheltenham on A40.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: A large area of broken surface has been sprayed over with a tar sealer - the uneven surface still exists. We drive 4x4 vehicles and it shakes them to bits - goodness knows what is is like hitting them in a Fiat 500!, 21st July
item.description:
Section of road outside no 59 Churchdown Lane

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown Lane, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Confusing No Entry sign (new), 20th July
item.description:
At the junction of Pirton Road and Cheltenham Road East. As you approach the traffic lights on Pirton Road from Churchdown you see a new No Entry sign on the right hand side. It is not clear whether this means you can’t turn right onto Cheltenham Road East or is only for the new slip road that seems to have been installed (assuming this is what it is???). I think you may need to make it clear which road this applies to!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is misaligned (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Large tree overhanging property and causing damage, 20th July
item.description:
There is a lovely chestnut tree outside my property, however in recent years it has become increasingly large and is causing damage to my property. I've had to have my drive re-laid due to the roots lifting it, the chestnuts falling from the tree cause damage to my car - which is parked on my drive - and the tree is hanging low over my driveway. I'd appreciate it if someone could assess and see if any work could take place to reduce it / move any overhang away from my property
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gully is full of silt and does not drain rainwater so requires clearing. The photos also show the road surface has broken up around gully and pothole forming so road surface also needs repair., 20th July
item.description:
The blocked gully and pothole are located at the end of the drive to the house called Tanglewood on New Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury

item.title: Large upholstered seat cushion left near bus stop after Swan Inn in Coombe Hill for Tewkesbury, 20th July
item.description:
The bus stop after Swan Inn Coombe Hill has large padded sofa cushion dumped. It has been there for 3-4 days and is a disgrace - others could follow suit - fly tipping!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villard Close, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction on public bridleway caused by Claydon Solar farm development, 20th July
item.description:
The Claydon PV solar farm development has put multiple concrete blocks in the middle of the bridleway where the construction site crosses over the bridleway at multiple points. This is extremely dangerous for horses as theres a significant risk that horses legs may get clipped/caught by the blocks, causing further injury to both horse and rider

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Supermarket trolley and e scooter chucked in river, 20th July
item.description:
The Sainsbury's trolley I reported ages ago on the trolley wise app (along with all the others dumped on Pilgrove way ) in the river Chelt along with an e scooter Voi one. There are others by the railings that children were trying to chuck over in to the he water.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: QUESTION : Will there be a second 'No Entry' sign at the new bust stop ?, 20th July
item.description:
QUESTION : Will there be a second 'No Entry' sign at the new bust stop ? Currently there is only one, sited between the bus layby and Cheltenham Road. Anyone unfamiliar with the traffic light arrangement approaching from Pirton Lane *might* think they cannot turn right at the traffic lights (towards Tesco). Would a second 'No Entry' sign on the Pirton Lane / houses side of the layby help clarify that the 'No Entry' is for the bus layby *only* ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
